org.threadly.litesockets.tcp

Class TCPClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.threadly.litesockets.Client
      • org.threadly.litesockets.tcp.TCPClient
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    SSLClient

    public class TCPClient
extends Client
    This is a generic Client for TCP connections. This client can be either from the "client" side or from a client from a TCP "Server", and both function the same way.

    • Nested Class Summary

    • Constructor Detail

      • TCPClient

        public TCPClient(java.lang.String host,
                 int port)
          throws java.io.IOException
        This creates a connection to the specified port and IP.
        Parameters:
        host - hostname or ip address to connect too.
        port - port on that host to try and connect too.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if for any reason a connection can not be made an IOException will throw with more details about why.

      • TCPClient

        public TCPClient(java.lang.String host,
                 int port,
                 int timeout)
          throws java.io.IOException
        This creates a connection to the specified port and IP.
        Parameters:
        host - hostname or ip address to connect too.
        port - port on that host to try and connect too.
        timeout - this is the max amount of time we will wait for a connection to be made (default is 10000 milliseconds).
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if for any reason a connection can not be made an IOException will throw with more details about why.

      • TCPClient

        public TCPClient(java.nio.channels.SocketChannel channel)
          throws java.io.IOException
        This creates a TCPClient based off an already existing SocketChannel.
        Parameters:
        channel - the SocketChannel to use for this client.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if there is anything wrong with the SocketChannel this will throw.

    • Method Detail

      • getChannel

        public java.nio.channels.SocketChannel getChannel()
        Description copied from class: Client
        Returns the SocketChannel for this client. If the client does not have a SocketChannel it will return null (ie UDPClient).
        Specified by:

      • isClosed

        public boolean isClosed()
        Description copied from class: Client
        Returns if this client is closed or not. Once a client is marked closed there is no way to reOpen it. You must just make a new client.
        Specified by:
        isClosed in class Client
        Returns:
        true if the client is closed, false if the client is connected.

      • close

        public void close()
        Description copied from class: Client
        closes this client. Any pending writes when this is called will just be dropped.
        Specified by:
        close in class Client

      • setReader

        public void setReader(Client.Reader reader)
        Description copied from class: Client
        This sets the Reader for the client. The Reader is called every time a new read is added to the client Each time a Reader is called it should call .getRead() *once* on the client
        Overrides:
        setReader in class Client
        Parameters:
        reader - the Reader interface to set for this client.

      • getReader

        public Client.Reader getReader()
        Description copied from class: Client
        Returns the currently set Reader callback.
        Overrides:
        getReader in class Client
        Returns:
        the current Reader for this client.

      • setCloser

        public void setCloser(Client.Closer closer)
        Description copied from class: Client
        This sets the Closer interface for this client. Once set the client will call .onClose on it once it a socket close is detected.
        Overrides:
        setCloser in class Client
        Parameters:
        closer - sets this clients Closer interface.

      • getCloser

        public Client.Closer getCloser()
        Description copied from class: Client
        This is used to get the current Closer for this client.
        Overrides:
        getCloser in class Client
        Returns:
        the current Closer interface for this client.

      • fakeClose

        protected void fakeClose()
        This is used by SSLClient to close the TCPClient object w/o closing its socket. We need to do this to make the TCPClient unuseable.

      • getProtocol

        public SocketExecuterBase.WireProtocol getProtocol()
        Description copied from class: Client
        This is used by the SocketExecuter to help understand how to manage this client. Currently only UDP and TCP exist.
        Specified by:
        getProtocol in class Client
        Returns:
        The IP protocol type of this client.
